articles.title: Rsdoctor 1.0: An Analyzer for Rspack and Webpack
articles.description: A one-stop, intelligent build analyzer making it easier to identify bottlenecks and optimize performance. It‚Äôs part of the same family of tools as Rspack (a Rust-powered web bundler) but is fully webpack compatible. If you‚Äôve ever asked why your build times are too long, this is for you.
articles.author: ByteDance Inc.

articles.title: üìâ¬†How We Made Our Rich Text Editor Load Faster
articles.description: CKEditor is a long-standing, full featured GPL and commercially licensed rich text editor but its complexity can come with a performance cost. In this two part series (part two here), the CKEditor team digs into how they‚Äôve recently significantly boosted its performance.
articles.author: Szymon Cofalik (CKEditor)

articles.title: Next.js vs TanStack
articles.description: An incisive essay from a developer who‚Äôs had enough of the Next.js approach and has found solace in the approach offered by the increasingly capable TanStack collection of tools (as well as Vite).
articles.author: Kyle Gill

articles.title: How to Build a Snake AI Game with Docker and TensorFlow.js
articles.description: You‚Äôve probably heard about people ‚Äòvibe coding‚Äô games by letting LLMs do the coding work, but what if you want to build a game yourself that has neural network powered elements? TensorFlow.js offers one solution that you could just as easily adapt to non-gaming contexts.
articles.author: Manvar and Raina (Docker)

articles.title: The Great ESLint v9 Migration Adventure: A Developer's Survival¬†Guide
articles.description: ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just say‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve seen things. I hit all the bumps, took all the wrong turns, and somehow made it to the other side‚Äîso you don‚Äôt have to.‚Äù
articles.author: Yacine Kharoubi

articles.title: React Trends in 2025
articles.description: Each year Robin does a post giving his opinion on what trends he sees arising over the next year. Last year, he put his money on Astro, RSCs, Vercel, and Biome ‚Äì this year he points at React Server Components, shadcn/ui, TanStack Start, React Router, and more.
articles.author: Robin Wieruch

articles.title: Build a Custom RAG AI Agent with TypeScript and Jupyter
articles.description: Deno, Ollama, and a few different AI models come together in this tutorial for storing document embeddings in a vector store and querying them for use in a basic agent.
articles.author: Kitson Kelly

articles.title: Introducing Motion for Vue
articles.description: Motion is a popular and powerful animation library most commonly associated with React, but now there‚Äôs a new Vue flavor and it‚Äôs feature complete, too.
articles.author: Matt Perry (Motion)

articles.title: Reveal.js 5.2: The HTML Presentation Framework
articles.description: Brings elegant presentations to anyone with a Web browser. v5.2 adds the ability to trigger ‚Äòlightboxes‚Äô where viewers can see images and videos in a way where they stand out more.
articles.author: Hakim El Hattab

articles.title: Konva: A JavaScript 2D Canvas Library
articles.description: The native API for Canvas elements is pretty good, but Konva is a popular abstraction that sits on top and provides a more structured way to work with shapes, styling, events, animations, and more (lots of demos with code). It also has extra integration libraries for Vue, Svelte and React.
articles.author: Konva

articles.title: Typist 8.0: Tiptap-Based Rich Text Editor Component
articles.description: Simple and opinionated. You can try several examples linked in the sidebar. Well suited for basic rich text situations like writing comments or messages and has a single-line mode. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Doist

articles.title: PeanoScript: TypeScript But It's a Theorem Prover
articles.description: An experimental proof assistant for Peano arithmetic based on TypeScript syntax.
articles.author: mjgrzymek

articles.description: This automatically updated runtime compatibility table lets you see how/if different server-side JavaScript runtimes support different APIs.
üí¨ If you'd like to hang out on Discord and chat with other Node.js developers, there's now an official Node.js Discord server.
The Node.js TSC has voted to stop distributing Corepack with future versions of Node. Corepack was originally introduced as a way to manage other package managers.
üõ†Ô∏è Make Bookmarklets is a handy tool for turning JavaScript into bookmarklet code that you can use directly in a browser bookmark.
Parcel v2.14.0 ‚Äì The zero-config bundler adds a new CLI to scaffold apps, first-class MDX support, and beta support for React Server Components.
Ionic 8.5 ‚Äì Cross-platform JS app development platform.
üìä Billboard.js 3.15.0 ‚Äì D3-powered JS chart library.
React Router 7.4

articles.title: The <select> Element Can Now Be Customized with¬†CSS
articles.description: There‚Äôs now an accessible, standardized way to create styleable <select> elements ‚Äî thanks to appearance: base-select. Adam shares how this has been ‚Äúmany years in the making‚Äù and after ‚Äúmany hours of engineering and collaborative specification work‚Äù we now have a rich component that won‚Äôt break in older browsers. Here‚Äôs a closer look at how things play in Chrome (the first to implement support), and how to use it.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: How to Think About Baseline and Polyfills
articles.description: Despite polyfills not being included as part of the Baseline project, Baseline can still help bring some nuance to the decision making around whether or not to use them.
articles.author: Jeremy Wagner

articles.title: Support Logical Shorthands in CSS
articles.description: The CSS Working Group recently resolved to add a size shorthand for setting both the width and height of an element. Many people asked about using it to set the ‚Äòlogical‚Äô inline-size and block-size properties instead. But ‚Äòlogical shorthands‚Äô have been stalled in the working group for years (since 2017!). Miriam asks if we get them unstuck?
articles.author: Miriam Suzanne

articles.title: Minding the Gaps: A New Way to Draw Separators in CSS
articles.description: Explains CSS gap decorations, a new proposal being worked on (and seeking feedback) for adding and extending fine-tune control over gap decorations.
articles.author: Babbitt & Brosset (Microsoft)

articles.title: Revisiting CSS border-image
articles.description: A deep dive into the powerful border-image property and how it can be used in various creative ways: ‚ÄúBy slicing, repeating, and outsetting images, you can create intricate borders, decorative elements, and even dynamic overlays with minimal code‚Äù.
articles.author: Andy Clarke

articles.title: The Bare Minimum You Need to Enable View Transitions on Your¬†Site
articles.description: View transitions are a solid way to make your site feel more dynamic and engaging when folks are navigating between pages. Here‚Äôs the basics for getting started.
articles.author: Amit Merchant

articles.title: Layered Text Headers
articles.description: Applying a stroke effect to text across all browsers is possible, but as Chris points out it makes use of a center-aligned look which ‚Äúlooks like üí©‚Äù (his words). However, the paint-order property may be worth a look as part of a solution for achieving a similar look.
articles.author: Chris Coyier

articles.title: Previewing Content Changes in Your Work with¬†document.designMode
articles.description: A look at several use cases for document.designMode and how it can be used to preview content changes, do basic content editing, and improve team collaboration.
articles.author: Victor Ayomipo

articles.title: Best Practices for Cognitive Accessibility in Web Design
articles.description: Lots of good practical advice here, covering ways to improve your website‚Äôs cognitive accessibility.
articles.author: Caitlin de Rooij

articles.title: An MCP Server for Playwright and Browser Automation
articles.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers enable certain LLM-based agents (such as Claude, Claude Code, and Cursor) to perform actions on a system outside of their usual sandbox. This new project from Microsoft enables such LLMs to interact with Web pages in a structured way (much as Playwright lets you do from Python or JavaScript code).
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: CASCII: A Web-Based ASCII and Unicode Diagram Builder
articles.description: Imagine something like MS Paint but for text-based drawing. You can switch between ASCII and Unicode modes and enable a background grid for alignment. Export directly to clipboard or in Base64.
articles.author: Caspar Wylie

articles.title: Konva: A JavaScript 2D Canvas Library
articles.description: The native API for Canvas elements is pretty good, but Konva is a popular abstraction that sits on top and provides a more structured way to work with shapes, styling, events, animations, and more (lots of demos with code). It also has extra integration libraries for Vue, Svelte and React.
articles.author: Konva

articles.title: Reveal.js 5.2: The HTML Presentation Framework
articles.description: Brings elegant presentations to anyone with a Web browser. v5.2 adds the ability to trigger ‚Äòlightboxes‚Äô where viewers can see images and videos in a way where they stand out more.
articles.author: Hakim El Hattab

articles.title: Parvus 3.0: Accessible Lightbox with No Dependencies
articles.description: I love how it says not to use overlays on web pages but if you have to, use this! There‚Äôs a CodePen example.
articles.author: Benjamin de Oostfrees

articles.title: Fancy Components: A Growing Library of Ready-to-Use Animated React Components
articles.description: Includes a whole slew of components for doing various text animations, along with others for backgrounds, physics-related animations, SVG filters, and more. Try them out here.
articles.author: Daniel Petho

articles.title: StringTune: The JavaScript Library Born from a Design Agency‚Äôs¬†Workflow
articles.description: A look at how to make use of this flexible JavaScript library for animations, smooth scrolling, and interactive effects. npm package.
articles.author: Fiddle.Digital
